艾菊叶（costmary）或叫迷迭香（rostmary）、月桂叶（bay leave）、牛汁（oregano flake）、百里香（thyme）、沉金根粉末（turm…

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from obsolete cost (via Latin from Greek kostos, via Arabic from Sanskrit kustha, denoting an aromatic plant) + Mary, the mother of Christ (with whom it was associated in medieval times because of its medicinal qualities)

means.word_mean: 1. tansy-scented Eurasian perennial herb with buttonlike yellow flowers; used as potherb or salad green and sometimes for potpourri or tea or flavoring; sometimes placed in genus Chrysanthemum
2. leaves used sparingly (because of bitter overtones) in sauces and soups and stuffings
